DataElement.preferredName: Acute Leukemia Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the type of acute leukemia, in which the involved cell shows little or no differentiation, usually consisting of blast cells, identified as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Leukemia Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to acute leukemia, in which the involved cell shows little or no differentiation, usually consisting of blast cells, as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: leukemia in which the involved cell shows little or no differentiation, usually consisting of blast cells; two types are distinguished, acute lymphocytic and acute myelogenous leukemia.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005:Performed; carried out.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the specified free-text field related to an aspect of patient/participant's diagnosis

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
